_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Imperial Valley Cooling LLC



Section A 

RMP Executive Summary

    

IVC cools, stores and ships fresh produce at our 817 West Hackman Avenue Facility located in El Centro CA.  We have a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner. 



Anhydrous Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 



We take many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have contracted with an Industrial Refrigeration Contractor to perform our preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going mechanical integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency response procedures that enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets. 



To the best of our knowledge the previous operator had no releases or accidents related to our ammonia refrigeration system within the past 5 years. 



The Facility Manager is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs. 



Ammonia is the only substance covered by the CalARP California Accidental Release Prevention Program handled at this facility. 



The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health 

Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule and CalARP program 3 requirements. The prevention program consists of the following elements: 



?    Employee Participatio

n Program

?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training Program

?    Contractor Safety Program

?    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

?    Mechanical Integrity Program

?    Hot Work Permit Procedures

?    Confined Space Entry Program

?    Lock out/tagout program

?    Respirator Program

?    Management of Change Procedures

?    Incident Investigation Procedures

?    Compliance Audit Procedures

?    Record keeping Procedures 



. 



An emergency response program has been implemented at the facility. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.  The program has been coordinated with local fire department officials and the Imperial County Environmental Health Department the Local CalARP Administrator. 





We have currently identified 3 potential changes to improve the safety of our ammonia refrigeration system.



Change 1.  We are going to paint all exterior uninsulated piping to retard corrosion



Change 2.  We are adding roof top support attachment to the roof piping racks



Change 3    We are reviewing all SOP's
